definition: flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to both share the limelight/to both have an equal share of

sentences.english: Evenly divide the mixture, approximately 2 tablespoons per cup, among the muffin cups.
sentences.chinese: 平分混合物，大约每杯2勺，放在松饼杯里。

sentences.english: Evenly divide the mixture approximately 2 tablespoons per cup among the muffin cups. < o<="" span="">
sentences.chinese: 平分混合物，大约每杯2勺，放在松饼杯里。

sentences.english: Zoom out and space and time play equal parts, in line with Lorentz symmetry.
sentences.chinese: 缩小时空间和时间平分秋色，与洛伦兹对称相一致。

sentences.english: Without that goal the two Milanese teams would be tied.
sentences.chinese: 如果没有那粒进球，两支米兰球队将平分秋色。

sentences.english: The stamp duty and the legal costs will be shared equally between both of you.
sentences.chinese: 至于印花税和律师费将由买卖双方平分。

sentences.english: The line AB is a bisector.
Let's split the prize money fifty-fifty.
sentences.chinese: 我们俩平分这项奖金吧。

sentences.english: Pity, we could have split the fee.
sentences.chinese: 可惜了，我们本来可以平分的。

sentences.english: Both hydrogens are going to share equally.
sentences.chinese: 两个氢原子将平分能量。

sentences.english: The parent companies split the sales and profits from the venture.
sentences.chinese: 两家母公司平分合资公司的销售收入和利润。

sentences.english: And, forgetting his motto: "half shares," he took all.
sentences.chinese: 他全部拿走了，忘了他所说的“平分”。

sentences.english: The OpenSSL performance was identical between the two systems.
sentences.chinese: 两个系统中的OpenSSL性能平分秋色。

sentences.english: You can divide this between you.
sentences.chinese: 这个你们可以两人平分。

sentences.english: Behind collecting team, they divide the gains thing equally right away.
sentences.chinese: 在收队后，他们就平分所得的东西。

sentences.english: Divvy up the money between us.

definition: to divide (into)/to split a bonus/to break into/tenths/percentage allotment
to share the booty/to divide ill-gotten gains
to spread out/(fig.) to share equally
to hand over to/to give to higher authority/to seek connections in high places
to scrape together enough (people, money etc)
